Module io.github.ascopes.jct
Package io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers

Class JctCompilationFactory<A extends JctCompiler<A,JctCompilationImpl>>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ascopes.jct.compilers.JctCompilationFactory<A>
Type Parameters:
A - the compiler implementation to use.
@API(since="0.0.1", status=EXPERIMENTAL) public class JctCompilationFactory<A extends JctCompiler<A,JctCompilationImpl>> extends Object
Helper for performing a compilation using a given compiler.
Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Ashley Scopes

  • Method Details

    • compile

      public JctCompilationImpl compile(A compiler, FileManagerBuilder builder, JavaCompiler jsr199Compiler, JctFlagBuilder flagBuilder)
      Run the compilation for the given compiler and return the compilation result.
      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to run.
      builder - the template to compile files within.
      jsr199Compiler - the underlying JSR-199 compiler to run via.
      flagBuilder - the flag builder to use.
      Returns:
      the compilation result.

    • performCompilerPass

      protected JctCompilationFactory.CompilationResult performCompilerPass(A compiler, JavaCompiler jsr199Compiler, TeeWriter writer, List<String> flags, JctFileManager fileManager, TracingDiagnosticListener<JavaFileObject> diagnosticListener, Set<JavaFileObject> previousCompilationUnits) throws IOException
      Run compilation once, after discovering any new sources to compile.
      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler object..
      jsr199Compiler - the JSR-199 compiler.
      writer - the output log writer.
      flags - the flags to pass to the compiler.
      fileManager - the file manager to use.
      diagnosticListener - the diagnostic listener to use.
      previousCompilationUnits - any previous compilation units. This will be updated after each call.
      Returns:
      the outcome of the compilation.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an IOException occurs during processing.

    • buildWriter

      protected TeeWriter buildWriter(A compiler)
      Build the TeeWriter to dump compiler logs to.
      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      Returns:
      the tee writer.

    • buildFlags

      protected List<String> buildFlags(A compiler, JctFlagBuilder flagBuilder)
      Build the flags to pass to the JSR-199 compiler.
      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      flagBuilder - the flag builder to use.
      Returns:
      the flags to use.

    • buildFileManager

      protected JctFileManager buildFileManager(A compiler, FileManagerBuilder builder)
      Build the JavaFileManager to use.

      LoggingMode will be applied to this via applyLoggingToFileManager(JctCompiler, JctFileManager), which will be handled by compile(JctCompiler, FileManagerBuilder, JavaCompiler, JctFlagBuilder).

      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      Returns:
      the file manager to use.

    • findCompilationUnits

      protected List<? extends JavaFileObject> findCompilationUnits(JavaFileManager fileManager, Set<JavaFileObject> previousCompilationUnits) throws IOException
      Discover all relevant compilation units for the file manager.

      The default implementation will consider both StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH and StandardLocation.MODULE_SOURCE_PATH locations.

      Parameters:
      fileManager - the file manager to get the compilation units for.
      previousCompilationUnits - the compilation units that were already compiled. This enables tracking which sources change in the file manager root during compilation to enable recompilation of generated sources automatically.
      Returns:
      the list of compilation units.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an IO error occurs discovering any compilation units.

    • applyLoggingToFileManager

      protected JctFileManager applyLoggingToFileManager(A compiler, JctFileManager fileManager)
      Apply the logging level to the file manager provided by buildFileManager(JctCompiler, FileManagerBuilder).

      The default implementation will wrap the given JavaFileManager in a LoggingFileManagerProxy if the JctCompiler.getFileManagerLoggingMode() field is not set to LoggingMode.DISABLED. In the latter scenario, the input will be returned to the caller with no other modifications.

      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      fileManager - the file manager to apply to.
      Returns:
      the file manager to use for future operations.

    • buildDiagnosticListener

      protected TracingDiagnosticListener<JavaFileObject> buildDiagnosticListener(A compiler)
      Build a diagnostics listener.

      This will also apply the desired logging configuration to the listener before returning it.

      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      Returns:
      the diagnostics listener.

    • buildCompilationTask

      protected JavaCompiler.CompilationTask buildCompilationTask(A compiler, JavaCompiler jsr199Compiler, Writer writer, JctFileManager fileManager, DiagnosticListener<? super JavaFileObject> diagnosticListener, List<String> flags, List<? extends JavaFileObject> compilationUnits)
      Build the compilation task.
      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      jsr199Compiler - the JSR-199 compiler to use internally.
      writer - the writer to write diagnostics to.
      fileManager - the file manager to use.
      diagnosticListener - the diagnostic listener to use.
      flags - the flags to pass to the JSR-199 compiler.
      compilationUnits - the compilation units to compile with.
      Returns:
      the compilation task, ready to be run.

    • runCompilationTask

      protected boolean runCompilationTask(A compiler, JavaCompiler.CompilationTask task)
      Run the compilation task.

      Any exceptions that get thrown will be wrapped in JctCompilerException instances before being rethrown.

      Parameters:
      compiler - the compiler to use.
      task - the task to run.
      Returns:
      true if the compilation succeeded, or false if compilation failed.
      Throws:
      JctCompilerException - if compilation throws an unhandled exception.
